example.eg: There was a stack of papers on the teacher's desk, waiting to be marked.
example.egtrans: 老师的桌子上有一叠等着评分的卷子。

example.eg: Alison stacked the books on the table.
example.egtrans: 艾莉森将书在桌子上堆成堆。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 将...叠加在, 将...在...上堆成堆, 将...迭加在...上

example.eg: The supermarket employee was stacking the shelves when Simon asked him which aisle the chocolate was in.
example.egtrans: 当西蒙询问巧克力在哪条货道时，超市工作人员正在往货架上上货。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 往（货架上）上货, 堆放于

example.eg: Maria was stacking the shelves with tins of beans.
example.egtrans: 玛利亚正在往架子上堆放豆子罐头。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 将…上堆满…, 在…上堆放…

example.eg: I have a stack of work to do this week.
example.egtrans: 我这周有一大堆工作要做。

example.eg: The teenager complained his teacher had given him stacks of homework to do.
example.egtrans: 那个年轻人抱怨自己的老师布置了一大堆作业。

example.eg: Graduate students can go into the stacks to find their own books; undergraduates should ask library staff for assistance.
example.egtrans: 研究生能够自己去书架找需要的书，本科生则需要向图书馆工作人员求助。

example.eg: Lydia looked at the tall stacks emerging from the building's roof.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 烟囱, 烟道, 烟突

example.eg: The fields were dotted with stacks of hay.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 一堆干草, 一堆稻草

example.eg: He realised sadly that the odds were stacked against him.
Jeff's problems started to stack up following the loss of his job.
No matter how you looked at it, the numbers simply didn't stack up.

dsense.name: blow your top, blow your stack
stack the deck, stack the cards

example.eg: The government had stacked the decks to the advantage of their cronies.

dsense.name: stack the deck against [sb/sth], stack the cards against [sb/sth]

trans_examp.trans_cn: 用作弊手段让...处于劣势

example.eg: I stacked up all the books on my table.
